page.title: 05GOFF'S PARK, CRAWLEY
page.content: Many people visit this natural park for its variety. There is an enclosed paddling pool surrounded by trees and play area for children. Others can relax with a hot cup of tea or a cold ice cream. For active children there are swings and apparatus. Train lovers can take a miniature railway journey through the trees. Boats can be sailed on a small pond. Nature lovers find squirrels, birds, fish and trees. A main attraction is the big landscaped pond with gardens. Geese and ducks will eat leftovers from picnics. Goff's House, the Area Education Office and the original residence of the park, and the Council's glass- houses are near the pond. Energetic adults use the pitch and putt course. Crawley Cricket Club play on the green most weekends in summer. Walkers on Sundays can listen to the silver band.
